entries.english: Gacukari, Gathumo, Gatumia, Kambara, Kĩbuda, Kĩganda, Mbiri, Mũraru, Mũtahato, Mũtore, Njuru (gacuru, mũcũru), Nyoro, Wanga'e

Mũndĩ/bundi (handyman - carpenter/plumber), Mũrĩmi (farmer), Ndereba (driver), Atongoria (leaders), Borithi (police), Mũũbĩa (priest-catholic), Mũhũrĩri wa mbica (photographer), Mũgwĩmi (hunter), Mũrĩithia wa mahiũ (herder), Aturi (iron mongers), Ombi a nyũngũ (potters), Mũgo (medicine person)

Aciari (parents), Rũrĩrĩ (community/tribe speaking one language), Ciana (children), Kenda mũiyũrũ (the full nine/ten), Tũhĩĩ (boys), Tũirĩtu (girls), Nyũmba (house/woman's hut), Thingira (men's hut), Ikũmbĩ (granary), Mũgũnda (garden/farm), Gĩcagi (village)

Heho (cold), Ũrugarĩ (heat/warmth), Mwaki (fire), Gĩchĩnga (smoldering stick with fire), Burana (cardigan/sweater), Ĩgooti (coat), Kabuti (overcoat), Mũrĩngĩti (blanket), Ĩkĩra (put/put on/wear), Kwĩhũmba (to wear), Mũno (very much)

Guka/Wagui (Grandfather - Muranga/Kiambu vs Nyeri), Cũcũ (Grandmother), Tata (Aunt), Mama (Uncle-mother's side), Baba mũnini (Uncle-father's younger brother), Baba mũkũrũ (Uncle-father's older brother), Mũrũ wa tata (Cousin-aunt's son), Mũrũ wa mama (Cousin-uncle's son), Mũrũ wa maitũ (Brother), Mwarĩ wa maitũ (Sister), Mũrũ wa baba (Half Brother), Mwarĩ wa baba (Half Sister)
Ikinya (foot/step), Ihenya (race), Kĩnya (gourd), Kinya (arrive/step on/up to), Hinya (strength), Menya (know), Kunya (pinch), Nyanya (tomato), Munya (uproot), Hihinya (squeeze/press)
Mbata (duck), Ngũkũ ya mwera (hen), Gacui (chick), Ngũkũ ya njamba (cock), Nyamũ ya thĩ (snake - polite/euphemistic)
